intro: Isolepis leptocaulis, commonly known as slender spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant features slender, grass-like stems that are typically less than 10 cm in height. Its inflorescence consists of a dense spike of small, three-ranked spikelets. Isolepis leptocaulis plays a vital role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
